event.doc_name: Plaintiffs' Motion for Temporary Restraining Order

evidence.text: For the reasons provided in the attached memorandum, Plaintiffs hereby move for a temporary restraining order under Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 65: 1. Enjoining Defendant Scott Turner and Defendant Department of Housing and Urban Development, and any person in active concert or participation with those parties, (a) from requiring Pennsylvania Coalition Against Domestic Violence, House of Hope Community Development Corporation, Rhode Island Coalition to End Homelessness, or Virginia Sexual and Domestic Violence Action Alliance’s members to agree to the following conditions or substantially similar conditions as a requirement for receiving funding; and (b) from otherwise enforcing these or substantially similar conditions against those organizations...
evidence.source_document: Plaintiffs' Motion for Temporary Restraining Order

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Motion for Temporary Restraining Order on July 21, 2025, seeking to enjoin Defendants from requiring organizations to agree to conditions related to funding restrictions under Executive Orders 14168 and 14182, and to order Defendants to confirm notification of the TRO within 24 hours.

event.doc_name: Plaintiffs' Motion for Relief Under 5 U.S.C. 705 and for Preliminary Injunction

evidence.text: For the reasons provided in the attached memorandum, Plaintiffs hereby move for preliminary relief under 5 U.S.C. § 705 and for a preliminary injunction, as set forth more fully below.
evidence.source_document: Plaintiffs' Motion for Relief Under 5 U.S.C. 705 and for Preliminary Injunction

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Motion for Preliminary Injunction on August 4, 2025, seeking to stay and preliminarily set aside HUD and HHS policies requiring recipients to comply with conditions related to funding restrictions under Executive Orders 14168 and 14182, and to enjoin Defendants from enforcing these conditions on organizations receiving federal funding.

event.doc_name: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: RHODE ISLAND COALITION AGAINST DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, et al. Plaintiffs, v. ROBERT F. KENNEDY, JR., in his official capacity as Secretary of the United States Department of Health and Human Services, et al. Defendants. COMPLAINT FOR DECLARATORY AND INJUNCTIVE RELIEF
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: 1 | 2025-07-21 | COMPLAINT ( filing fee paid $ 405.00, receipt number ARIDC-2162532 ), filed by Foster Forward, Iowa Coalition Against Domestic Violence, Wisconsin Coalition Against Sexual Assault, California Partnership to End Domestic Violence, Rhode Island Coalition Against Domestic Violence, House of Hope Community Development Corporation, Virginia Sexual and Domestic Violence Action Alliance, ValorUS, Community Care Alliance, Montana Coalition Against Domestic and Sexual Violence, North Carolina Coalition Against Domestic Violence, Haus of Codec, Pennsylvania Coalition Against Domestic Violence, Idaho Coalition Against Sexual and Domestic Violence, Colorado Coalition Against Sexual Assault, Kansas Coalition Against Sexual and Domestic Violence, Oregon Coalition Against Domestic and Sexual Violence, Violence Free Minnesota, Jane Doe Inc., The Massachusetts Coalition Against Sexual Assault and Domestic Violence, District of Columbia Coalition Against Domestic Violence, Rhode Island Coalition to End Homelessness, End Domestic Abuse Wisconsin: The Wisconsin Coalition Against Domestic Violence. (Attachments: # 1 Civil Cover Sheet)(Romero, Amy) (Entered: 07/21/2025)

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed the Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief on July 21, 2025, initiating the case against Defendants by alleging that federal funding conditions imposed by HUD and HHS violate the APA, due process, and the First Amendment, and seeking to halt funding restrictions related to Executive Orders 14168 and 14182.

evidence.text: 28 | 2025-08-04 | MOTION to Amend/Correct 23 Order on Motion for TRO filed by All Plaintiffs. Responses due by 8/18/2025.

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Motion to Amend/Correct the Temporary Restraining Order on August 4, 2025, seeking revisions to the order to address specific deficiencies, with responses due August 18, 2025.

evidence.text: 31 | 2025-08-06 | Second MOTION to Amend/Correct 23 Order on Motion for TRO filed by All Plaintiffs. Responses due by 8/20/2025.

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Second Motion to Amend/Correct the Temporary Restraining Order on August 6, 2025, requesting further revisions to the order, with responses due August 20, 2025.

evidence.text: 35 | 2025-08-07 | Third MOTION to Amend/Correct 23 Order on Motion for TRO filed by All Plaintiffs. Responses due by 8/21/2025.

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Third Motion to Amend/Correct the Temporary Restraining Order on August 7, 2025, seeking to clarify the order's scope, with responses due August 21, 2025.

evidence.text: 42 | 2025-08-18 | Fourth MOTION to Amend/Correct 37 Order on Motion for TRO filed by All Plaintiffs. Responses due by 9/2/2025.

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Fourth Motion to Amend/Correct the Temporary Restraining Order on August 18, 2025, requesting additional modifications to the order, with responses due September 2, 2025.
